851{
852 const auto it = warning_record.find( id );
853 if( it != warning_record.end() ) {

855 if( it->second.second - calendar::turn > 5_minutes ) {

◆ can_continue_craft()

bool player::can_continue_craft ( item &  craft)

Check if the player meets the requirements to continue the in progress craft and if unable to continue print messages explaining the reason.

If the craft is missing components due to messing up, prompt to consume new ones to allow the craft to be continued.

Parameters
craftthe currently in progress craft
Returns
if the craft can be continued

Definition at line 1156 of file crafting.cpp.

1157{

1160 return false;
1161 }
1162 if( has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
1163 return true;
1164 }
1165
1166 const recipe &rec = craft.get_making();
1167
1168 const requirement_data continue_reqs = craft.get_continue_reqs();
1169
1170 // Avoid building an inventory from the map if we don't have to, as it is expensive
1171 if( !continue_reqs.is_empty() ) {
1172
1173 std::function<bool( const item & )> filter = rec.get_component_filter();
1174 const std::function<bool( const item & )> no_rotten_filter =
1175 rec.get_component_filter( recipe_filter_flags::no_rotten );
1176 // continue_reqs are for all batches at once
1177 const int batch_size = 1;
1178
1179 if( !continue_reqs.can_make_with_inventory( crafting_inventory(), filter, batch_size ) ) {
1180 std::string buffer = _( "You don't have the required components to continue crafting!" );
1181 buffer += "\n";
1182 buffer += continue_reqs.list_missing();
1183 popup( buffer, PF_NONE );
1184 return false;
1185 }
1186
1187 std::string buffer = _( "Consume the missing components and continue crafting?" );
1188 buffer += "\n";
1189 buffer += continue_reqs.list_all();
1190 if( !query_yn( buffer ) ) {
1191 return false;
1192 }
1193
1194 if( continue_reqs.can_make_with_inventory( crafting_inventory(), no_rotten_filter,
1195 batch_size ) ) {
1196 filter = no_rotten_filter;
1197 } else {
1198 if( !query_yn( _( "Some components required to continue are rotten.\n"
1199 "Continue crafting anyway?" ) ) ) {
1200 return false;
1201 }
1202 }
1203
1204 inventory map_inv;
1205 map_inv.form_from_map( pos(), PICKUP_RANGE, this );
1206
1207 std::vector<comp_selection<item_comp>> item_selections;
1208 for( const auto &it : continue_reqs.get_components() ) {
1209 comp_selection<item_comp> is = select_item_component( it, batch_size, map_inv, true, filter );
1210 if( is.use_from == cancel ) {
1211 cancel_activity();
1212 add_msg( _( "You stop crafting." ) );
1213 return false;
1214 }
1215 item_selections.push_back( is );
1216 }
1217 for( const auto &it : item_selections ) {
1218 craft.components.splice( craft.components.end(), consume_items( it, batch_size, filter ) );
1219 }
1220 }
1221
1222 if( !craft.has_tools_to_continue() ) {
1223
1224 const std::vector<std::vector<tool_comp>> &tool_reqs = rec.simple_requirements().get_tools();
1225 const int batch_size = craft.charges;
1226
1227 std::vector<std::vector<tool_comp>> adjusted_tool_reqs;
1228 for( const std::vector<tool_comp> &alternatives : tool_reqs ) {
1229 std::vector<tool_comp> adjusted_alternatives;
1230 for( const tool_comp &alternative : alternatives ) {
1231 tool_comp adjusted_alternative = alternative;
1232 if( adjusted_alternative.count > 0 ) {
1233 adjusted_alternative.count *= batch_size;
1234 // Only for the next 5% progress
1235 adjusted_alternative.count = std::max(
1236 crafting::charges_for_continuing( adjusted_alternative.count ), 1 );
1237 }
1238 adjusted_alternatives.push_back( adjusted_alternative );
1239 }
1240 adjusted_tool_reqs.push_back( adjusted_alternatives );
1241 }
1242
1243 const requirement_data tool_continue_reqs( adjusted_tool_reqs,
1244 std::vector<std::vector<quality_requirement>>(),
1245 std::vector<std::vector<item_comp>>() );
1246
1247 if( !tool_continue_reqs.can_make_with_inventory( crafting_inventory(), return_true<item> ) ) {
1248 std::string buffer = _( "You don't have the necessary tools to continue crafting!" );
1249 buffer += "\n";
1250 buffer += tool_continue_reqs.list_missing();
1251 popup( buffer, PF_NONE );
1252 return false;
1253 }
1254
1255 inventory map_inv;
1256 map_inv.form_from_map( pos(), PICKUP_RANGE, this );
1257
1258 std::vector<comp_selection<tool_comp>> new_tool_selections;
1259 for( const std::vector<tool_comp> &alternatives : tool_reqs ) {
1260 comp_selection<tool_comp> selection =
1261 crafting::select_tool_component( alternatives, batch_size, map_inv, this, true, DEFAULT_HOTKEYS,
1262 cost_adjustment::continue_only );
1263 if( selection.use_from == cancel ) {
1264 return false;
1265 }
1266 new_tool_selections.push_back( selection );
1267 }
1268
1269 craft.set_cached_tool_selections( new_tool_selections );
1270 craft.set_tools_to_continue( true );
1271 }
1272
1273 return true;
1274}
PICKUP_RANGE

Items on the map with at most this distance to the player are considered available for crafting,...

◆ check_eligible_containers_for_crafting()

bool player::check_eligible_containers_for_crafting ( const recipe &  rec,
int  batch_size = 1 
) const

Definition at line 413 of file crafting.cpp.

414{
415 std::vector<const item *> conts = get_eligible_containers_for_crafting();
416 const std::vector<item> res = rec.create_results( batch_size );
417 const std::vector<item> bps = rec.create_byproducts( batch_size );
418 std::vector<item> all;
419 all.reserve( res.size() + bps.size() );
420 all.insert( all.end(), res.begin(), res.end() );
421 all.insert( all.end(), bps.begin(), bps.end() );
422
423 map &here = get_map();
424 for( const item &prod : all ) {
425 if( !prod.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
426 continue;
427 }
428
429 // we go through half-filled containers first, then go through empty containers if we need
430 std::sort( conts.begin(), conts.end(), item_ptr_compare_by_charges );
431
432 int charges_to_store = prod.charges;
433 for( const item *cont : conts ) {
434 if( charges_to_store <= 0 ) {
435 break;
436 }
437
438 if( !cont->is_container_empty() ) {
439 if( cont->contents.front().typeId() == prod.typeId() ) {
440 charges_to_store -= cont->get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( cont->contents.front(), true );
441 }
442 } else {
443 charges_to_store -= cont->get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( prod, true );
444 }
445 }
446
447 // also check if we're currently in a vehicle that has the necessary storage
448 if( charges_to_store > 0 ) {
449 if( optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( pos() ) ) {
450 const itype_id &ftype = prod.typeId();
451 int fuel_cap = vp->vehicle().fuel_capacity( ftype );
452 int fuel_amnt = vp->vehicle().fuel_left( ftype );
453
454 if( fuel_cap >= 0 ) {
455 int fuel_space_left = fuel_cap - fuel_amnt;
456 charges_to_store -= fuel_space_left;
457 }
458 }
459 }
460
461 if( charges_to_store > 0 ) {
462 if( !query_yn(
463 _( "You don't have anything in which to store %s and may have to pour it out or consume it as soon as it is prepared! Proceed?" ),
464 prod.tname() ) ) {
465 return false;
466 }
467 }
468 }
469
470 return true;
471}

bool player::consume ( item_location  loc)

Used for eating object at pos, returns true if object is removed from inventory (last charge was consumed)

796{
797 item &target = *loc;
798 const bool wielding = is_wielding( target );
799 const bool worn = is_worn( target );
800 const bool inv_item = !( wielding || worn );
801
802 if( consume_item( target ) ) {
803
804 const bool was_in_container = !can_consume_as_is( target );
805
806 if( was_in_container ) {
807 i_rem( &target.contents.front() );
808 } else {
809 i_rem( &target );
810 }
811
812 //Restack and sort so that we don't lie about target's invlet
813 if( inv_item ) {
814 inv.restack( *this );
815 }
816
817 if( was_in_container && wielding ) {
818 add_msg_if_player( _( "You are now wielding an empty %s." ), weapon.tname() );
819 } else if( was_in_container && worn ) {
820 add_msg_if_player( _( "You are now wearing an empty %s." ), target.tname() );
821 } else if( was_in_container && !is_npc() ) {
822 bool drop_it = false;
823 if( get_option<std::string>( "DROP_EMPTY" ) == "no" ) {
824 drop_it = false;
825 } else if( get_option<std::string>( "DROP_EMPTY" ) == "watertight" ) {
826 drop_it = !target.is_watertight_container();
827 } else if( get_option<std::string>( "DROP_EMPTY" ) == "all" ) {
828 drop_it = true;
829 }
830 if( drop_it ) {
831 add_msg( _( "You drop the empty %s." ), target.tname() );
832 put_into_vehicle_or_drop( *this, item_drop_reason::deliberate, { inv.remove_item( &target ) } );
833 } else {
834 int quantity = inv.const_stack( inv.position_by_item( &target ) ).size();
835 char letter = target.invlet ? target.invlet : ' ';
836 add_msg( m_info, _( "%c - %d empty %s" ), letter, quantity, target.tname( quantity ) );
837 }
838 }
839 } else if( inv_item ) {
840 if( pickup::handle_spillable_contents( *this, target, g->m ) ) {
841 i_rem( &target );
842 }
843 inv.restack( *this );
844 inv.unsort();
845 }
846
847 return true;
848}

1527 // Count given to use_amount/use_charges, changed by those functions!
1528 int real_count = ( selected_comp.count > 0 ) ? selected_comp.count * batch : std::abs(
1529 selected_comp.count );
1530 // First try to get everything from the map, than (remaining amount) from player
1531 if( is.use_from & use_from_map ) {
1532 if( by_charges ) {
1533 std::list<item> tmp = m.use_charges( loc, radius, selected_comp.type, real_count, filter );
1534 ret.splice( ret.end(), tmp );
1535 } else {
1536 std::list<item> tmp = g->m.use_amount( loc, radius, selected_comp.type, real_count, filter );

1538 ret.splice( ret.end(), tmp );

1540 }

1543 std::list<item> tmp = use_charges( selected_comp.type, real_count, filter );

1545 } else {
1546 std::list<item> tmp = use_amount( selected_comp.type, real_count, filter );
1547 remove_ammo( tmp, *this );
1548 ret.splice( ret.end(), tmp );
1549 }
1550 }

1553 std::list<item>::iterator b = ret.begin();
1554 b++;
1555 while( ret.size() > 1 ) {
1556 ret.front().charges += b->charges;
1557 b = ret.erase( b );
1558 }
1559 }

1561 empty_buckets( *this );
1562 return ret;

bool player::consume_med ( item &  target)
private

Consumes an item as medication.

Parameters

Definition at line 678 of file player.cpp.

679{
680 if( !target.is_medication() ) {
681 return false;
682 }
683
684 const itype_id tool_type = target.get_comestible()->tool;
685 const itype *req_tool = &*tool_type;
686 bool tool_override = false;
687 if( tool_type == itype_syringe && has_bionic( bio_syringe ) ) {
688 tool_override = true;
689 }
690 if( req_tool->tool ) {
691 if( !( has_amount( tool_type, 1 ) && has_charges( tool_type, req_tool->tool->charges_per_use ) ) &&
692 !tool_override ) {
693 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You need a %s to consume that!" ), req_tool->nname( 1 ) );
694 return false;
695 }
696 use_charges( tool_type, req_tool->tool->charges_per_use );
697 }
698
699 int amount_used = 1;
700 if( target.type->has_use() ) {
701 amount_used = target.type->invoke( *this, target, pos() );
702 if( amount_used <= 0 ) {
703 return false;
704 }
705 }
706
707 // TODO: Get the target it was used on
708 // Otherwise injecting someone will give us addictions etc.
709 if( target.has_flag( "NO_INGEST" ) ) {
710 const auto &comest = *target.get_comestible();
711 // Assume that parenteral meds don't spoil, so don't apply rot
712 modify_health( comest );
713 modify_stimulation( comest );
714 modify_fatigue( comest );
715 modify_radiation( comest );
716 modify_addiction( comest );
717 modify_morale( target );
718 } else {
719 // Take by mouth
720 consume_effects( target );
721 }
722
723 mod_moves( -250 );
724 target.charges -= amount_used;
725 return target.charges <= 0;
726}

◆ craft_consume_tools()

bool player::craft_consume_tools ( item &  craft,
int  mulitplier,
bool  start_craft 
)

Consume tools for the next multiplier * 5% progress of the craft.

Definition at line 1750 of file crafting.cpp.

1751{

1753 debugmsg( "craft_consume_tools() called on non-craft '%s.' Aborting.", craft.tname() );

1758 }
1759 if( start_craft && mulitplier > 1 ) {
1760 debugmsg( "start_craft is true, but multiplier is %d > 1", mulitplier );
1761 return false;
1762 }
1763
1764 const auto calc_charges = [&craft, &start_craft, &mulitplier]( int charges ) {
1765 int ret = charges;
1766
1767 if( charges <= 0 ) {
1768 return ret;
1769 }
1770
1771 // Account for batch size
1772 int full_cost = charges * craft.charges;
1773
1774 if( start_craft ) {
1775 return crafting::charges_for_starting( full_cost );
1776 } else {
1777 // In case more than 5% progress was accomplished in one turn
1778 return crafting::charges_for_continuing( full_cost ) * mulitplier;
1779 }
1780 };
1781
1782 // First check if we still have our cached selections
1783 const std::vector<comp_selection<tool_comp>> &cached_tool_selections =
1784 craft.get_cached_tool_selections();
1785
1786 inventory map_inv;
1787 map_inv.form_from_map( pos(), PICKUP_RANGE, this );
1788
1789 for( const comp_selection<tool_comp> &tool_sel : cached_tool_selections ) {
1790 itype_id type = tool_sel.comp.type;
1791 if( tool_sel.comp.count > 0 ) {
1792 const int count = calc_charges( tool_sel.comp.count );
1793 switch( tool_sel.use_from ) {
1794 case use_from_player:
1795 if( !has_charges( type, count ) ) {
1796 add_msg_player_or_npc(
1797 _( "You have insufficient %s charges and can't continue crafting" ),
1798 _( "<npcname> has insufficient %s charges and can't continue crafting" ),
1799 item::nname( type ) );
1800 craft.set_tools_to_continue( false );
1801 return false;
1802 }
1803 break;
1804 case use_from_map:
1805 if( !map_inv.has_charges( type, count ) ) {
1806 add_msg_player_or_npc(
1807 _( "You have insufficient %s charges and can't continue crafting" ),
1808 _( "<npcname> has insufficient %s charges and can't continue crafting" ),
1809 item::nname( type ) );
1810 craft.set_tools_to_continue( false );
1811 return false;
1812 }
1813 break;
1814 case use_from_both:
1815 case use_from_none:
1816 case cancel:
1817 case num_usages:
1818 break;
1819 }
1820 } else if( !has_amount( type, 1 ) && !map_inv.has_tools( type, 1 ) ) {
1821 add_msg_player_or_npc(
1822 _( "You no longer have a %s and can't continue crafting" ),
1823 _( "<npcname> no longer has a %s and can't continue crafting" ),
1824 item::nname( type ) );
1825 craft.set_tools_to_continue( false );
1826 return false;
1827 }
1828 }
1829
1830 // We have the selections, so consume them
1831 for( const comp_selection<tool_comp> &tool : cached_tool_selections ) {
1832 comp_selection<tool_comp> to_consume = tool;
1833 to_consume.comp.count = calc_charges( to_consume.comp.count );
1834 consume_tools( to_consume, 1 );
1835 }
1836 return true;
1837}

bool has_charges(const itype_id &it, int quantity, const std::function< bool(const item &)> &filter=return_true< item >) const
Definition: inventory.cpp:893

◆ craft_skill_gain()

void player::craft_skill_gain ( const item &  craft,
const int &  multiplier 
)

Handle skill gain for player and followers during crafting.

Parameters
craftthe currently in progress craft
multiplierwhat factor to multiply the base skill gain by. This is used to apply multiple steps of incremental skill gain simultaneously if needed.

Definition at line 771 of file crafting.cpp.

772{
773 if( !craft.is_craft() ) {
774 debugmsg( "craft_skill_check() called on non-craft '%s.' Aborting.", craft.tname() );
775 return;
776 }
777
778 const recipe &making = craft.get_making();
779 const int batch_size = craft.charges;
780
781 std::vector<npc *> helpers = get_crafting_helpers();
782
783 if( making.skill_used ) {
784 // Normalize experience gain to crafting time, giving a bonus for longer crafting
785 const double batch_mult = batch_size + base_time_to_craft( making, batch_size ) / 30000.0;
786 // This is called after every 5% crafting progress, so divide by 20
787 // TODO: Don't multiply, instead divide the crafting time into more "learn bits"
788 const int base_practice = roll_remainder( ( making.difficulty * 15 + 10 ) * batch_mult /
789 20.0 ) * multiplier;
790 const int skill_cap = static_cast<int>( making.difficulty * 1.25 );
791 practice( making.skill_used, base_practice, skill_cap, true );
792
793 // NPCs assisting or watching should gain experience...
794 for( auto &helper : helpers ) {
795 //If the NPC can understand what you are doing, they gain more exp
796 if( helper->get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) >= making.difficulty ) {
797 helper->practice( making.skill_used, roll_remainder( base_practice / 2.0 ),
798 skill_cap );
799 if( batch_size > 1 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
800 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s assists with crafting…" ), helper->name );
801 }
802 if( batch_size == 1 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
803 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s could assist you with a batch…" ), helper->name );
804 }
805 // NPCs around you understand the skill used better
806 } else {
807 helper->practice( making.skill_used, roll_remainder( base_practice / 10.0 ),
808 skill_cap );
809 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
810 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s watches you craft…" ), helper->name );
811 }
812 }
813 }
814 }
815}

◆ crafting_success_roll()

double player::crafting_success_roll ( const recipe &  making) const

Calculate a value representing the success of the player at crafting the given recipe, taking player skill, recipe difficulty, npc helpers, and player mutations into account.

Parameters
makingthe recipe for which to calculate
Returns
a value >= 0.0 with >= 1.0 representing unequivocal success
Intelligence increases crafting success chance

Definition at line 817 of file crafting.cpp.

818{
819 int secondary_dice = 0;
820 int secondary_difficulty = 0;
821 for( const auto &pr : making.required_skills ) {
822 secondary_dice += get_skill_level( pr.first );
823 secondary_difficulty += pr.second;
824 }
825
826 // # of dice is 75% primary skill, 25% secondary (unless secondary is null)
827 int skill_dice;
828 if( secondary_difficulty > 0 ) {
829 skill_dice = get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) * 3 + secondary_dice;
830 } else {
831 skill_dice = get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) * 4;
832 }
833
834 for( const npc *np : get_crafting_helpers() ) {
835 if( np->get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) >=
836 get_skill_level( making.skill_used ) ) {
837 // NPC assistance is worth half a skill level
838 skill_dice += 2;
839 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "%s helps with crafting…" ), np->name );
840 break;
841 }
842 }
843
844 // farsightedness can impose a penalty on electronics and tailoring success
845 // it's equivalent to a 2-rank electronics penalty, 1-rank tailoring
846 if( has_trait( trait_HYPEROPIC ) && !worn_with_flag( flag_FIX_FARSIGHT ) &&
847 !has_effect( effect_contacts ) ) {
848 int main_rank_penalty = 0;
849 if( making.skill_used == skill_electronics ) {
850 main_rank_penalty = 2;
851 } else if( making.skill_used == skill_tailor ) {
852 main_rank_penalty = 1;
853 }
854 skill_dice -= main_rank_penalty * 4;
855 }
856
857 // It's tough to craft with paws. Fortunately it's just a matter of grip and fine-motor,
858 // not inability to see what you're doing
859 for( const trait_id &mut : get_mutations() ) {
860 for( const std::pair<const skill_id, int> &skib : mut->craft_skill_bonus ) {
861 if( making.skill_used == skib.first ) {
862 skill_dice += skib.second;
863 }
864 }
865 }
866
867 // Sides on dice is 16 plus your current intelligence
868 ///\EFFECT_INT increases crafting success chance
869 const int skill_sides = 16 + int_cur;
870
871 int diff_dice;
872 if( secondary_difficulty > 0 ) {
873 diff_dice = making.difficulty * 3 + secondary_difficulty;
874 } else {
875 // Since skill level is * 4 also
876 diff_dice = making.difficulty * 4;
877 }
878
879 const int diff_sides = 24; // 16 + 8 (default intelligence)
880
881 const double skill_roll = dice( skill_dice, skill_sides );
882 const double diff_roll = dice( diff_dice, diff_sides );
883
884 if( diff_roll == 0 ) {
885 // Automatic success
886 return 2;
887 }
888
889 return skill_roll / diff_roll;
890}

◆ disarm()

void player::disarm ( npc &  target)

Try to disarm the NPC.

May result in fail attempt, you receiving the wepon and instantly wielding it, or the weapon falling down on the floor nearby. NPC is always getting angry with you.

Parameters
targetTarget NPC to disarm
Strength increases chance to disarm, primary stat Dexterity increases chance to disarm, secondary stat Melee increases chance to disarm Unarmed increases chance to disarm, bonus when nothing wielded

2311 if( !target.is_armed() ) {
2312 return;
2313 }

2316 target.on_attacked( *this );
2317 return;

2319
2320 /** @EFFECT_STR increases chance to disarm, primary stat */
2321 /** @EFFECT_DEX increases chance to disarm, secondary stat */
2322 int my_roll = dice( 3, 2 * get_str() + get_dex() );
2323
2324 /** @EFFECT_MELEE increases chance to disarm */
2325 my_roll += dice( 3, get_skill_level( skill_melee ) );
2326

2328 their_roll += dice( 3, target.get_per() );
2329 their_roll += dice( 3, target.get_skill_level( skill_melee ) );
2330
2331 item &it = target.weapon;
2332
2333 // roll your melee and target's dodge skills to check if grab/smash attack succeeds
2334 int hitspread = target.deal_melee_attack( this, hit_roll() );
2335 if( hitspread < 0 ) {
2336 add_msg( _( "You lunge for the %s, but miss!" ), it.tname() );
2337 mod_moves( -100 - stumble( *this, weapon ) - attack_cost( weapon ) );
2338 target.on_attacked( *this );
2339 return;
2340 }
2341

2353 item rem_it = target.i_rem( &it );
2354 wield( rem_it );
2355 } else if( my_roll >= their_roll / 2 ) {
2356 add_msg( _( "You grab at %s and pull with all your force, but it drops nearby!" ),
2357 it.tname() );
2358 const tripoint tp = target.pos() + tripoint( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ), 0 );
2359 g->m.add_item_or_charges( tp, target.i_rem( &it ) );
2360 mod_moves( -100 );
2361 } else {
2362 add_msg( _( "You grab at %s and pull with all your force, but in vain!" ), it.tname() );
2363 mod_moves( -100 );
2364 }
2365
2366 target.on_attacked( *this );
2367 return;
2368 }
2369
2370 // Make their weapon fall on floor if we've rolled enough.
2371 mod_moves( -100 - attack_cost( weapon ) );
2372 if( my_roll >= their_roll ) {
2373 add_msg( _( "You smash %s with all your might forcing their %s to drop down nearby!" ),
2374 target.name, it.tname() );
2375 const tripoint tp = target.pos() + tripoint( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ), 0 );
2376 g->m.add_item_or_charges( tp, target.i_rem( &it ) );
2377 } else {
2378 add_msg( _( "You smash %s with all your might but %s remains in their hands!" ),
2379 target.name, it.tname() );
2380 }
2381
2382 target.on_attacked( *this );
2383}

◆ eat()

bool player::eat ( item &  food,

)

Used for eating entered comestible, returns true if comestible is successfully eaten.

824 return false;

828 if( !ret.success() ) {
829 return false;
830 }
831

834 !food.has_flag( flag_NO_BLOAT ) ) {
835 add_msg_if_player( _( "You force yourself to vomit to make space for %s." ), food.tname() );
836 vomit();
837 }
838
839 int charges_used = 0;
840 if( food.type->has_use() ) {
841 if( !food.type->can_use( "DOGFOOD" ) &&
842 !food.type->can_use( "CATFOOD" ) &&
843 !food.type->can_use( "BIRDFOOD" ) &&
844 !food.type->can_use( "CATTLEFODDER" ) ) {
845 charges_used = food.type->invoke( *this, food, pos() );
846 if( charges_used <= 0 ) {
847 return false;
848 }
849 }
850 }
851
852 // Note: the block below assumes we decided to eat it
853 // No coming back from here
854
855 const int nutr = nutrition_for( food );
856 const bool spoiled = food.rotten();
857
858 // The item is solid food
859 const bool chew = food.get_comestible()->comesttype == comesttype_FOOD ||
860 food.has_flag( flag_USE_EAT_VERB );
861 // This item is a drink and not a solid food (and not a thick soup)
862 const bool drinkable = !chew && food.get_comestible()->comesttype == comesttype_DRINK;
863 // If neither of the above is true then it's a drug and shouldn't get mealtime penalty/bonus
864
865 const bool saprophage = has_trait( trait_SAPROPHAGE );
866 if( spoiled && !saprophage ) {
867 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Ick, this %s doesn't taste so good…" ), food.tname() );
868 if( !has_trait( trait_SAPROVORE ) && !has_trait( trait_EATDEAD ) &&
869 !has_bionic( bio_digestion ) ) {
870 add_effect( effect_foodpoison, rng( 6_minutes, ( nutr + 1 ) * 6_minutes ) );
871 }
872 } else if( spoiled && saprophage ) {
873 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Mmm, this %s tastes delicious…" ), food.tname() );
874 }
875 if( !consume_effects( food ) ) {
876 // Already consumed by using `food.type->invoke`?
877 if( charges_used > 0 ) {
878 food.mod_charges( -charges_used );
879 }
880 return false;
881 }
882 food.mod_charges( -1 );
883
884 const bool amorphous = has_trait( trait_AMORPHOUS );
885 int mealtime = 250;
886 if( drinkable || chew ) {
887 // Those bonuses/penalties only apply to food
888 // Not to smoking weed or applying bandages!
889 if( has_trait( trait_MOUTH_TENTACLES ) || has_trait( trait_MANDIBLES ) ||
890 has_trait( trait_FANGS_SPIDER ) ) {
891 mealtime /= 2;
892 } else if( has_trait( trait_SHARKTEETH ) ) {
893 // SHARKBAIT! HOO HA HA!
894 mealtime /= 3;
895 } else if( has_trait( trait_GOURMAND ) ) {
896 // Don't stack those two - that would be 25 moves per item
897 mealtime -= 100;
898 }
899
900 if( has_trait( trait_BEAK_HUM ) && !drinkable ) {
901 // Much better than PROBOSCIS but still optimized for fluids
902 mealtime += 200;
903 } else if( has_trait( trait_SABER_TEETH ) ) {
904 // They get In The Way
905 mealtime += 250;
906 }
907
908 if( amorphous ) {
909 mealtime *= 1.1;
910 // Minor speed penalty for having to flow around it
911 // rather than just grab & munch
912 }
913 }
914
915 moves -= mealtime;
916
917 // If it's poisonous... poison us.
918 // TODO: Move this to a flag
919 if( food.poison > 0 && !has_trait( trait_POISRESIST ) &&
920 !has_trait( trait_EATDEAD ) ) {
921 if( food.poison >= rng( 2, 4 ) ) {
922 add_effect( effect_poison, food.poison * 10_minutes );
923 }
924
925 add_effect( effect_foodpoison, food.poison * 30_minutes );
926 }
927
928 if( food.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_HALLU ) ) {
929 if( !has_effect( effect_hallu ) ) {
930 add_effect( effect_hallu, 6_hours );
931 }
932 }
933
934 if( amorphous ) {
935 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "You assimilate your %s." ), _( "<npcname> assimilates a %s." ),
936 food.tname() );
937 } else if( drinkable ) {
938 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "You drink your %s." ), _( "<npcname> drinks a %s." ),
939 food.tname() );
940 } else if( chew ) {
941 add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "You eat your %s." ), _( "<npcname> eats a %s." ),
942 food.tname() );
943 }
944
945 if( food.get_comestible()->tool->tool ) {
946 // Tools like lighters get used
947 use_charges( food.get_comestible()->tool, 1 );
948 }
949
950 if( food.has_flag( flag_FUNGAL_VECTOR ) && !has_trait( trait_M_IMMUNE ) ) {
951 add_effect( effect_fungus, 1_turns, num_bp );
952 }
953
954 // Chance to become parasitised
955 if( !( has_bionic( bio_digestion ) || has_trait( trait_PARAIMMUNE ) ) ) {
956 if( food.get_comestible()->parasites > 0 && !food.has_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES ) &&
957 one_in( food.get_comestible()->parasites ) ) {
958 switch( rng( 0, 3 ) ) {
959 case 0:
960 add_effect( effect_tapeworm, 1_turns, num_bp );
961 break;
962 case 1:
963 if( !has_trait( trait_ACIDBLOOD ) ) {
964 add_effect( effect_bloodworms, 1_turns, num_bp );
965 }
966 break;
967 case 2:
968 add_effect( effect_brainworms, 1_turns, num_bp );
969 break;
970 case 3:
971 add_effect( effect_paincysts, 1_turns, num_bp );
972 }
973 }
974 }
975
976 for( const std::pair<const diseasetype_id, int> &elem : food.get_comestible()->contamination ) {
977 if( rng( 1, 100 ) <= elem.second ) {
978 expose_to_disease( elem.first );
979 }
980 }
981
982 consumption_history->elems.emplace_back( food );
983 // Clean out consumption_history so it doesn't get bigger than needed.
984 while( consumption_history->elems.front().time < calendar::turn - 2_days ) {
985 consumption_history->elems.pop_front();
986 }
987
988 return true;
989}

◆ fall_damage_mod()

float player::fall_damage_mod ( ) const
overridevirtual

Returns multiplier on fall damage at low velocity (knockback/pit/1 z-level, not 5 z-levels)

Dexterity decreases damage from falling Dodge decreases damage from falling

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 367 of file player.cpp.

368{
369 if( has_effect_with_flag( "EFFECT_FEATHER_FALL" ) ) {
370 return 0.0f;
371 }
372 float ret = 1.0f;
373
374 // Ability to land properly is 2x as important as dexterity itself
375 /** @EFFECT_DEX decreases damage from falling */
376
377 /** @EFFECT_DODGE decreases damage from falling */
378 float dex_dodge = dex_cur / 2.0 + get_skill_level( skill_dodge );
379 // Penalize for wearing heavy stuff
380 const float average_leg_encumb = ( encumb( bp_leg_l ) + encumb( bp_leg_r ) ) / 2.0;
381 dex_dodge -= ( average_leg_encumb + encumb( bp_torso ) ) / 10;
382 // But prevent it from increasing damage
383 dex_dodge = std::max( 0.0f, dex_dodge );
384 // 100% damage at 0, 75% at 10, 50% at 20 and so on
385 ret *= ( 100.0f - ( dex_dodge * 4.0f ) ) / 100.0f;
386
387 if( has_trait( trait_PARKOUR ) ) {
388 ret *= 2.0f / 3.0f;
389 }
390
391 // TODO: Bonus for Judo, mutations. Penalty for heavy weight (including mutations)
392 return std::max( 0.0f, ret );
393}

◆ fire_gun() [1/2]

int player::fire_gun ( const tripoint &  target,
int  shots,
item &  gun 
)

Fires a gun or auxiliary gunmod (ignoring any current mode)

Parameters
targetwhere the first shot is aimed at (may vary for later shots)
shotsmaximum number of shots to fire (less may be fired in some circumstances)
gunitem to fire (which does not necessary have to be in the players possession)
Returns
number of shots actually fired

Definition at line 811 of file ranged.cpp.

812{
813 if( !gun.is_gun() ) {
814 debugmsg( "%s tried to fire non-gun (%s).", name, gun.tname() );
815 return 0;
816 }
817 bool is_mech_weapon = false;
818 if( is_mounted() &&
819 mounted_creature->has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
820 is_mech_weapon = true;
821 }
822
823 int shots = max_shots;
824 // Number of shots to fire is limited by the amount of remaining ammo
825 if( gun.ammo_required() ) {
826 shots = std::min( shots, static_cast<int>( gun.ammo_remaining() / gun.ammo_required() ) );
827 }
828
829 // cap our maximum burst size by the amount of UPS power left
830 if( !gun.has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) && gun.get_gun_ups_drain() > 0 ) {
831 shots = std::min( shots, static_cast<int>( charges_of( itype_UPS ) / gun.get_gun_ups_drain() ) );
832 }
833
834 if( shots <= 0 ) {
835 debugmsg( "Attempted to fire zero or negative shots using %s", gun.tname() );
836 }
837
838 cata::optional<shape_factory> shape;
839 if( gun.ammo_current() && gun.ammo_current()->ammo ) {
840 shape = gun.ammo_current()->ammo->shape;
841 }
842
843 map &here = get_map();
844 // Shaped attacks don't allow aiming, so they don't suffer from lack of aim either
845 int character_recoil = shape ? recoil_vehicle() : recoil_total();
846 // Penalty is (intentionally) based off mode shots, not ammo-limited.
847 dispersion_sources dispersion = calculate_dispersion( here, *this, gun, character_recoil,
848 max_shots > 1 );
849
850 bool aoe_attack = gun.gun_skill() == skill_launcher || shape;
851 tripoint aim = target;
852 int curshot = 0;
853 int hits = 0; // total shots on target
854 while( curshot != shots ) {
855 if( gun.faults.count( fault_gun_chamber_spent ) && curshot == 0 ) {
856 moves -= 50;
857 gun.faults.erase( fault_gun_chamber_spent );
858 add_msg_if_player( _( "You cycle your %s manually." ), gun.tname() );
859 }
860
861 if( !ranged::handle_gun_damage( *this, gun ) ) {
862 break;
863 }
864
865 // If this is a vehicle mounted turret, which vehicle is it mounted on?
866 const vehicle *in_veh = has_effect( effect_on_roof ) ? veh_pointer_or_null( here.veh_at(
867 pos() ) ) : nullptr;
868 projectile projectile = make_gun_projectile( gun );
869
870 // Damage reduction from insufficient strength, if using a STR_DRAW weapon.
871 projectile.impact.mult_damage( ranged::str_draw_damage_modifier( gun, *this ) );
872
873 if( has_trait( trait_NORANGEDCRIT ) ) {
874 projectile.add_effect( ammo_effect_NO_CRIT );
875 }
876 if( !shape ) {
877 auto shot = projectile_attack( projectile, pos(), aim, dispersion, this, in_veh );
878 if( shot.missed_by <= .1 ) {
879 // TODO: check head existence for headshot
880 g->events().send<event_type::character_gets_headshot>( getID() );
881 }
882
883 if( shot.hit_critter ) {
884 hits++;
885 }
886 } else {
887 // 30 degree cap, like for projectiles
888 double angle_offset_arcmin = std::min( dispersion.roll(), 1800.0 ) * ( one_in( 2 ) ? 1 : -1 );
889 double angle_offset = units::to_radians( units::from_arcmin( angle_offset_arcmin ) );
890 double dx = aim.x - pos().x;
891 double dy = aim.y - pos().y;
892 double new_angle = atan2( dy, dx ) + angle_offset;
893 // Always using trig here, rotations in maximum metric are weird
894 double length = trig_dist( pos(), aim );
895 rl_vec3d vec_pos( pos() );
896 rl_vec3d new_aim = vec_pos + rl_vec3d( length, 0, 0 ).rotated( new_angle );
897 ranged::execute_shaped_attack( *shape->create( vec_pos, new_aim ), projectile, *this );
898 }
899 curshot++;
900
901 make_gun_sound_effect( *this, shots > 1, &gun );
902 sfx::generate_gun_sound( *this, gun );
903
904 cycle_action( gun, pos() );
905
906 if( has_trait( trait_PYROMANIA ) && !has_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_STARTFIRE ) ) {
907 if( gun.has_flag( flag_PYROMANIAC_WEAPON ) ) {
908 add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "You feel a surge of euphoria as flames roar out of the %s!" ),
909 gun.tname() );
910 add_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_STARTFIRE, 15, 15, 8_hours, 6_hours );
911 rem_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_NOFIRE );
912 }
913 }
914
915 if( gun.ammo_consume( gun.ammo_required(), pos() ) != gun.ammo_required() ) {
916 debugmsg( "Unexpected shortage of ammo whilst firing %s", gun.tname() );
917 break;
918 }
919
920 if( !gun.has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) ) {
921 use_charges( itype_UPS, gun.get_gun_ups_drain() );
922 }
923
924 if( aoe_attack ) {
925 continue; // skip retargeting for launchers
926 }
927 }
928
929 if( gun.has_flag( flag_RELOAD_AND_SHOOT ) ) {
930 // Reset aim for bows and other reload-and-shoot weapons.
931 recoil = MAX_RECOIL;
932 } else {
933 // Now actually apply recoil for the future shots
934 // But only for one shot, because bursts kinda suck
935 int gun_recoil = gun.gun_recoil( can_use_bipod( here, pos() ) );
936
937 // If user is currently able to fire a mounted gun freely, penalize recoil based on size class.
938 if( gun.has_flag( flag_MOUNTED_GUN ) && !can_use_bipod( here, pos() ) ) {
939 if( get_size() == MS_HUGE ) {
940 gun_recoil = gun_recoil * 2;
941 } else {
942 gun_recoil = gun_recoil * 3;
943 }
944 }
945
946 recoil += gun_recoil;
947 if( is_mech_weapon ) {
948 // mechs can handle recoil far better. they are built around their main gun.
949 recoil = recoil / 2;
950 }
951 recoil = std::min( MAX_RECOIL, recoil );
952 }
953
954 // Use different amounts of time depending on the type of gun and our skill
955 moves -= time_to_attack( *this, *gun.type );
956
957 // Practice the base gun skill proportionally to number of hits, but always by one.
958 practice( skill_gun, ( hits + 1 ) * 5 );
959 // launchers train weapon skill for both hits and misses.
960 int practice_units = aoe_attack ? curshot : hits;
961 practice( gun.gun_skill(), ( practice_units + 1 ) * 5 );
962
963 return curshot;
964}

◆ gunmod_add()

void player::gunmod_add ( item &  gun,

)

Starts activity to install gunmod having warned user about any risk of failure or irremovable mods s.

Definition at line 2139 of file player.cpp.

2140{
2141 if( !gun.is_gunmod_compatible( mod ).success() ) {
2142 debugmsg( "Tried to add incompatible gunmod" );
2143 return;
2144 }
2145
2146 if( !has_item( gun ) && !has_item( mod ) ) {
2147 debugmsg( "Tried gunmod installation but mod/gun not in player possession" );
2148 return;
2149 }
2150
2151 // first check at least the minimum requirements are met
2152 if( !has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) && !can_use( mod, gun ) ) {
2153 return;
2154 }
2155
2156 // any (optional) tool charges that are used during installation
2157 auto odds = gunmod_installation_odds( gun, mod );
2158 int roll = odds.first;
2159 int risk = odds.second;
2160
2161 std::string tool;
2162 int qty = 0;
2163 bool requery = false;
2164
2165 item modded = gun;
2166 modded.put_in( mod );
2167 bool no_magazines = modded.common_ammo_default().is_null();
2168
2169 std::string query_msg = mod.is_irremovable()
2170 ? _( "<color_yellow>Permanently</color> install your %1$s in your %2$s?" )
2171 : _( "Attach your %1$s to your %2$s?" );
2172 if( no_magazines ) {
2173 query_msg += "\n";
2174 query_msg += colorize(
2175 _( "Warning: after installing this mod, a magazine adapter mod will be required to load it!" ),
2176 c_red );
2177 }
2178
2179 uilist prompt;
2180 prompt.text = string_format( query_msg,
2181 colorize( mod.tname(), mod.color_in_inventory() ),
2182 colorize( gun.tname(), gun.color_in_inventory() ) );
2183
2184 std::vector<std::function<void()>> actions;
2185
2186 if( roll < 100 ) {
2187 prompt.addentry( -1, true, 'w',
2188 string_format( _( "Try without tools (%i%%) risking damage (%i%%)" ), roll, risk ) );
2189 actions.emplace_back( [&] {} );
2190
2191 prompt.addentry( -1, has_charges( itype_small_repairkit, 100 ), 'f',
2192 string_format( _( "Use 100 charges of firearm repair kit (%i%%)" ), std::min( roll * 2, 100 ) ) );
2193
2194 actions.emplace_back( [&] {
2195 tool = "small_repairkit";
2196 qty = 100;
2197 roll *= 2; // firearm repair kit improves success...
2198 risk /= 2; // ...and reduces the risk of damage upon failure
2199 } );
2200
2201 prompt.addentry( -1, has_charges( itype_large_repairkit, 25 ), 'g',
2202 string_format( _( "Use 25 charges of gunsmith repair kit (%i%%)" ), std::min( roll * 3, 100 ) ) );
2203
2204 actions.emplace_back( [&] {
2205 tool = "large_repairkit";
2206 qty = 25;
2207 roll *= 3; // gunsmith repair kit improves success markedly...
2208 risk = 0; // ...and entirely prevents damage upon failure
2209 } );
2210 } else {
2211 prompt.addentry( -1, true, 'w', _( "Install without tools" ) );
2212 actions.emplace_back( [&] {} );
2213 }
2214
2215 prompt.addentry( -1, true, 'c', _( "Compare before/after installation" ) );
2216 actions.emplace_back( [&] {
2217 requery = true;
2218 game_menus::inv::compare( gun, modded );
2219 } );
2220
2221 do {
2222 requery = false;
2223 prompt.query();
2224 if( prompt.ret < 0 ) {
2225 add_msg_if_player( _( "Never mind." ) );
2226 return; // player canceled installation
2227 }
2228 actions[ prompt.ret ]();
2229 } while( requery );
2230
2231 const int moves = !has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ? mod.type->gunmod->install_time : 0;
2232
2233 assign_activity( activity_id( "ACT_GUNMOD_ADD" ), moves, -1, 0, tool );
2234 activity.targets.push_back( item_location( *this, &gun ) );
2235 activity.targets.push_back( item_location( *this, &mod ) );
2236 activity.values.push_back( 0 ); // dummy value
2237 activity.values.push_back( roll ); // chance of success (%)
2238 activity.values.push_back( risk ); // chance of damage (%)
2239 activity.values.push_back( qty ); // tool charges
2240}

◆ gunmod_installation_odds()

std::pair< int, int > player::gunmod_installation_odds ( const item &  gun,
const item &  mod 
) const
Returns
Odds for success (pair.first) and gunmod damage (pair.second)

Definition at line 2106 of file player.cpp.

2107{
2108 // Mods with INSTALL_DIFFICULT have a chance to fail, potentially damaging the gun
2109 if( !mod.has_flag( "INSTALL_DIFFICULT" ) || has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
2110 return std::make_pair( 100, 0 );
2111 }
2112
2113 int roll = 100; // chance of success (%)
2114 int risk = 0; // chance of failure (%)
2115 int chances = 1; // start with 1 in 6 (~17% chance)
2116
2117 for( const auto &e : mod.type->min_skills ) {
2118 // gain an additional chance for every level above the minimum requirement
2119 skill_id sk = e.first == skill_weapon ? gun.gun_skill() : e.first;
2120 chances += std::max( get_skill_level( sk ) - e.second, 0 );
2121 }
2122 // cap success from skill alone to 1 in 5 (~83% chance)
2123 roll = std::min( static_cast<double>( chances ), 5.0 ) / 6.0 * 100;
2124 // focus is either a penalty or bonus of at most +/-10%
2125 roll += ( std::min( std::max( focus_pool, 140 ), 60 ) - 100 ) / 4;
2126 // dexterity and intelligence give +/-2% for each point above or below 12
2127 roll += ( get_dex() - 12 ) * 2;
2128 roll += ( get_int() - 12 ) * 2;
2129 // each level of damage to the base gun reduces success by 10%
2130 roll -= std::max( gun.damage_level( 4 ), 0 ) * 10;
2131 roll = std::min( std::max( roll, 0 ), 100 );
2132
2133 // risk of causing damage on failure increases with less durable guns
2134 risk = ( 100 - roll ) * ( ( 10.0 - std::min( gun.type->gun->durability, 9 ) ) / 10.0 );
2135
2136 return std::make_pair( roll, risk );
2137}
Character::get_int
virtual int get_int() const
Definition: character.cpp:4088
item::damage_level
int damage_level(int max) const
Scale item damage to the given number of levels.
Definition: item.cpp:701

static const skill_id skill_weapon("weapon")
itype::gun
cata::value_ptr< islot_gun > gun

bool player::gunmod_remove ( item &  gun,

Removes gunmod after first unloading any contained ammo and returns true on success.

2058 debugmsg( "Cannot remove non-existent gunmod" );

2064 return false;
2065 }

2069

2071 gun.casings_handle( [&]( item & e ) {
2072 return i_add_or_drop( e );
2073 } );
2074 }
2075

2081 //If the removed gunmod added mod locations, check to see if any mods are in invalid locations
2082 if( !modtype->gunmod->add_mod.empty() ) {
2083 std::map<gunmod_location, int> mod_locations = gun.get_mod_locations();

2085 int free_slots = gun.get_free_mod_locations( slot.first );
2086

2088 if( the_mod->type->gunmod->location == slot.first && free_slots < 0 ) {
2089 gunmod_remove( gun, *the_mod );
2090 free_slots++;
2091 } else if( mod_locations.find( the_mod->type->gunmod->location ) ==
2092 mod_locations.end() ) {
2093 gunmod_remove( gun, *the_mod );
2094 }
2095 }
2096 }
2097 }
2098
2099 //~ %1$s - gunmod, %2$s - gun.
2100 add_msg_if_player( _( "You remove your %1$s from your %2$s." ), modtype->nname( 1 ),
2101 gun.tname() );
2102
2103 return true;

606{
607 const bodypart_id head_id = bodypart_id( "head" );
608 const bodypart_id torso_id = bodypart_id( "torso" );
609 int total_cur = 0;
610 int total_max = 0;
611 // Head and torso HP are weighted 3x and 2x, respectively
612 total_cur = get_part_hp_cur( head_id ) * 3 + get_part_hp_cur( torso_id ) * 2;
613 total_max = get_part_hp_max( head_id ) * 3 + get_part_hp_max( torso_id ) * 2;

617 }
618

◆ immune_to()

bool player::immune_to ( body_part  bp,
damage_unit  dam 
) const

Check if a given body part is immune to a given damage type.

This function checks whether a given body part cannot be damaged by a given damage_unit. Note that this refers only to reduction of hp on that part. It does not account for clothing damage, pain, status effects, etc.

Parameters
bpBody part to perform the check on
damType of damage to check for
Returns
true if given damage can not reduce hp of given body part

357

359 if( cloth.get_coverage() == 100 && cloth.covers( bp ) ) {
360 cloth.mitigate_damage( dam );
361 }
362 }
363

365}

◆ impact()

int player::impact ( int  force,
const tripoint &  pos 
)
overridevirtual

Deals falling/collision damage with terrain/creature at pos.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 396 of file player.cpp.

397{
398 // Falls over ~30m are fatal more often than not
399 // But that would be quite a lot considering 21 z-levels in game
400 // so let's assume 1 z-level is comparable to 30 force
401
402 if( force <= 0 ) {
403 return force;
404 }
405
406 // Damage modifier (post armor)
407 float mod = 1.0f;
408 int effective_force = force;
409 int cut = 0;
410 // Percentage armor penetration - armor won't help much here
411 // TODO: Make cushioned items like bike helmets help more
412 float armor_eff = 1.0f;
413 // Shock Absorber CBM heavily reduces damage
414 const bool shock_absorbers = has_active_bionic( bionic_id( "bio_shock_absorber" ) );
415
416 // Being slammed against things rather than landing means we can't
417 // control the impact as well
418 const bool slam = p != pos();
419 std::string target_name = "a swarm of bugs";
420 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( p );
421 if( critter != this && critter != nullptr ) {
422 target_name = critter->disp_name();
423 // Slamming into creatures and NPCs
424 // TODO: Handle spikes/horns and hard materials
425 armor_eff = 0.5f; // 2x as much as with the ground
426 // TODO: Modify based on something?
427 mod = 1.0f;
428 effective_force = force;
429 } else if( const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( p ) ) {
430 // Slamming into vehicles
431 // TODO: Integrate it with vehicle collision function somehow
432 target_name = vp->vehicle().disp_name();
433 if( vp.part_with_feature( "SHARP", true ) ) {
434 // Now we're actually getting impaled
435 cut = force; // Lots of fun
436 }
437
438 mod = slam ? 1.0f : fall_damage_mod();
439 armor_eff = 0.25f; // Not much
440 if( !slam && vp->part_with_feature( "ROOF", true ) ) {
441 // Roof offers better landing than frame or pavement
442 // TODO: Make this not happen with heavy duty/plated roof
443 effective_force /= 2;
444 }
445 } else {
446 // Slamming into terrain/furniture
447 target_name = g->m.disp_name( p );
448 int hard_ground = g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_DIGGABLE, p ) ? 0 : 3;
449 armor_eff = 0.25f; // Not much
450 // Get cut by stuff
451 // This isn't impalement on metal wreckage, more like flying through a closed window
452 cut = g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_SHARP, p ) ? 5 : 0;
453 effective_force = force + hard_ground;
454 mod = slam ? 1.0f : fall_damage_mod();
455 if( g->m.has_furn( p ) ) {
456 // TODO: Make furniture matter
457 } else if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, p ) ) {
458 // TODO: Some formula of swimming
459 effective_force /= 4;
460 }
461 }
462
463 // Rescale for huge force
464 // At >30 force, proper landing is impossible and armor helps way less
465 if( effective_force > 30 ) {
466 // Armor simply helps way less
467 armor_eff *= 30.0f / effective_force;
468 if( mod < 1.0f ) {
469 // Everything past 30 damage gets a worse modifier
470 const float scaled_mod = std::pow( mod, 30.0f / effective_force );
471 const float scaled_damage = ( 30.0f * mod ) + scaled_mod * ( effective_force - 30.0f );
472 mod = scaled_damage / effective_force;
473 }
474 }
475
476 if( !slam && mod < 1.0f && mod * force < 5 ) {
477 // Perfect landing, no damage (regardless of armor)
478 add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You land on %s." ), target_name );
479 return 0;
480 }
481
482 // Shock absorbers kick in only when they need to, so if our other protections fail, fall back on them
483 if( shock_absorbers ) {
484 effective_force -= 15; // Provide a flat reduction to force
485 if( mod > 0.25f ) {
486 mod = 0.25f; // And provide a 75% reduction against that force if we don't have it already
487 }
488 if( effective_force < 0 ) {
489 effective_force = 0;
490 }
491 }
492
493 int total_dealt = 0;
494 if( mod * effective_force >= 5 ) {
495 for( int i = 0; i < num_hp_parts; i++ ) {
496 const bodypart_id bp = convert_bp( hp_to_bp( static_cast<hp_part>( i ) ) ).id();
497 const int bash = effective_force * rng( 60, 100 ) / 100;
498 damage_instance di;
499 di.add_damage( DT_BASH, bash, 0, armor_eff, mod );
500 // No good way to land on sharp stuff, so here modifier == 1.0f
501 di.add_damage( DT_CUT, cut, 0, armor_eff, 1.0f );
502 total_dealt += deal_damage( nullptr, bp, di ).total_damage();
503 }
504 }
505
506 if( total_dealt > 0 && is_player() ) {
507 // "You slam against the dirt" is fine
508 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You are slammed against %1$s for %2$d damage." ),
509 target_name, total_dealt );
510 } else if( is_player() && shock_absorbers ) {
511 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You are slammed against %s!" ),
512 target_name, total_dealt );
513 add_msg( m_good, _( "…but your shock absorbers negate the damage!" ) );
514 } else if( slam ) {
515 // Only print this line if it is a slam and not a landing
516 // Non-players should only get this one: player doesn't know how much damage was dealt
517 // and landing messages for each slammed creature would be too much
518 add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad,
519 _( "You are slammed against %s." ),
520 _( "<npcname> is slammed against %s." ),
521 target_name );
522 } else {
523 // No landing message for NPCs
524 add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You land on %s." ), target_name );
525 }
526
527 if( x_in_y( mod, 1.0f ) ) {
528 add_effect( effect_downed, rng( 1_turns, 1_turns + mod * 3_turns ) );
529 }
530
531 return total_dealt;
532}
x_in_y
bool x_in_y(const time_duration &a, const time_duration &b)
Definition: calendar.cpp:521
cata_variant_type::bionic_id
@ bionic_id
Character::deal_damage

int  qty 
) const

Calculate (but do not deduct) the number of moves required to reload an item with specified quantity of ammo.

Parameters
itItem to calculate reload cost for
ammoeither ammo or magazine to use when reloading the item
qtymaximum units of ammo to reload. Capped by remaining capacity and ignored if reloading using a magazine.
Gun decreases the time taken to reload a magazine Pistol decreases time taken to reload a pistol Smg decreases time taken to reload an SMG Rifle decreases time taken to reload a rifle Shotgun decreases time taken to reload a shotgun Launcher decreases time taken to reload a launcher Strength reduces reload time of some weapons

Definition at line 1553 of file player.cpp.

1554{
1555 if( ammo.is_ammo() ) {
1556 qty = std::max( std::min( ammo.charges, qty ), 1 );
1557 } else if( ammo.is_ammo_container() || ammo.is_container() ) {
1558 qty = clamp( qty, ammo.contents.front().charges, 1 );
1559 } else if( ammo.is_magazine() ) {
1560 qty = 1;
1561 } else {
1562 debugmsg( "cannot determine reload cost as %s is neither ammo or magazine", ammo.tname() );
1563 return 0;
1564 }
1565
1566 // If necessary create duplicate with appropriate number of charges
1567 item obj = ammo;
1568 obj = obj.split( qty );
1569 if( obj.is_null() ) {
1570 obj = ammo;
1571 }
1572 // No base cost for handling ammo - that's already included in obtain cost
1573 // We have the ammo in our hands right now
1574 int mv = item_handling_cost( obj, true, 0 );
1575
1576 if( ammo.has_flag( "MAG_BULKY" ) ) {
1577 mv *= 1.5; // bulky magazines take longer to insert
1578 }
1579
1580 if( !it.is_gun() && !it.is_magazine() ) {
1581 return mv + 100; // reload a tool or sealable container
1582 }
1583
1584 /** @EFFECT_GUN decreases the time taken to reload a magazine */
1585 /** @EFFECT_PISTOL decreases time taken to reload a pistol */
1586 /** @EFFECT_SMG decreases time taken to reload an SMG */
1587 /** @EFFECT_RIFLE decreases time taken to reload a rifle */
1588 /** @EFFECT_SHOTGUN decreases time taken to reload a shotgun */
1589 /** @EFFECT_LAUNCHER decreases time taken to reload a launcher */
1590
1591 int cost = ( it.is_gun() ? it.get_reload_time() : it.type->magazine->reload_time ) * qty;
1592
1593 skill_id sk = it.is_gun() ? it.type->gun->skill_used : skill_gun;
1594 mv += cost / ( 1.0f + std::min( get_skill_level( sk ) * 0.1f, 1.0f ) );
1595
1596 if( it.has_flag( "STR_RELOAD" ) ) {
1597 /** @EFFECT_STR reduces reload time of some weapons */
1598 mv -= get_str() * 20;
1599 }
1600
1601 return std::max( mv, 25 );
1602}

Clamp first argument so that it is no lower than second and no higher than third.

◆ knock_back_to()

void player::knock_back_to ( const tripoint &  to)
overridevirtual

Knocks the player to a specified tile.

Maximum Strength allows knocked back player to knock back, damage, stun some monsters

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 534 of file player.cpp.

535{
536 if( to == pos() ) {
537 return;
538 }
539

543 intervening.x = pos().x;
544 } else {
545 intervening.y = pos().y;
546 }
547
548 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), 3 );

551 g->m.obstacle_name( intervening ) );
552 return;
553 }
554
555 // First, see if we hit a monster
556 if( monster *const critter = g->critter_at<monster>( to ) ) {
557 deal_damage( critter, bodypart_id( "torso" ), damage_instance( DT_BASH, critter->type->size ) );
558 add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
559 /** @EFFECT_STR_MAX allows knocked back player to knock back, damage, stun some monsters */
560 if( ( str_max - 6 ) / 4 > critter->type->size ) {
561 critter->knock_back_from( pos() ); // Chain reaction!
562 critter->apply_damage( this, bodypart_id( "torso" ), ( str_max - 6 ) / 4 );
563 critter->add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
564 } else if( ( str_max - 6 ) / 4 == critter->type->size ) {
565 critter->apply_damage( this, bodypart_id( "torso" ), ( str_max - 6 ) / 4 );
566 critter->add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
567 }
568 critter->check_dead_state();

571 critter->name() );
572 return;
573 }
574

581 np->check_dead_state();
582 return;

584

589 }
590 // TODO: NPCs can't swim!
591 } else if( g->m.impassable( to ) ) { // Wait, it's a wall
592
593 // It's some kind of wall.
594 // TODO: who knocked us back? Maybe that creature should be the source of the damage?

598 g->m.obstacle_name( to ) );
599
600 } else { // It's no wall
601 setpos( to );
602 }
603}

◆ mend_item()

void player::mend_item ( item_location &&  obj,
bool  interactive = true 
)

Attempt to mend an item (fix any current faults)

Parameters
objObject to mend
interactiveif true prompts player when multiple faults, otherwise mends the first

Definition at line 1397 of file player.cpp.

1398{
1399 if( has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
1400 uilist menu;
1401 menu.text = _( "Toggle which fault?" );
1402 std::vector<std::pair<fault_id, bool>> opts;
1403 for( const auto &f : obj->faults_potential() ) {
1404 opts.emplace_back( f, !!obj->faults.count( f ) );
1405 menu.addentry( -1, true, -1, string_format(
1406 opts.back().second ? pgettext( "fault", "Mend: %s" ) : pgettext( "fault", "Set: %s" ),
1407 f.obj().name() ) );
1408 }
1409 if( opts.empty() ) {
1410 add_msg( m_info, _( "The %s doesn't have any faults to toggle." ), obj->tname() );
1411 return;
1412 }
1413 menu.query();
1414 if( menu.ret >= 0 ) {
1415 if( opts[ menu.ret ].second ) {
1416 obj->faults.erase( opts[ menu.ret ].first );
1417 } else {
1418 obj->faults.insert( opts[ menu.ret ].first );
1419 }
1420 }
1421 return;
1422 }
1423
1424 auto inv = crafting_inventory();
1425
1426 struct mending_option {
1427 fault_id fault;
1428 std::reference_wrapper<const mending_method> method;
1429 bool doable;
1430 };
1431
1432 std::vector<mending_option> mending_options;
1433 for( const fault_id &f : obj->faults ) {
1434 for( const auto &m : f->mending_methods() ) {
1435 mending_option opt { f, m.second, true };
1436 for( const auto &sk : m.second.skills ) {
1437 if( get_skill_level( sk.first ) < sk.second ) {
1438 opt.doable = false;
1439 break;
1440 }
1441 }
1442 opt.doable = opt.doable &&
1443 m.second.requirements->can_make_with_inventory( inv, is_crafting_component );
1444 mending_options.emplace_back( opt );
1445 }
1446 }
1447
1448 if( mending_options.empty() ) {
1449 if( interactive ) {
1450 add_msg( m_info, _( "The %s doesn't have any faults to mend." ), obj->tname() );
1451 if( obj->damage() > 0 ) {
1452 const std::set<itype_id> &rep = obj->repaired_with();
1453 if( !rep.empty() ) {
1454 const std::string repair_options =
1455 enumerate_as_string( rep.begin(), rep.end(), []( const itype_id & e ) {
1456 return item::nname( e );
1457 }, enumeration_conjunction::or_ );
1458
1459 add_msg( m_info, _( "It is damaged, and could be repaired with %s. "
1460 "%s to use one of those items." ),
1461 repair_options, press_x( ACTION_USE ) );
1462 }
1463 }
1464 }
1465 return;
1466 }
1467
1468 int sel = 0;
1469 if( interactive ) {
1470 uilist menu;
1471 menu.text = _( "Mend which fault?" );
1472 menu.desc_enabled = true;
1473 menu.desc_lines_hint = 0; // Let uilist handle description height
1474
1475 constexpr int fold_width = 80;
1476
1477 for( const mending_option &opt : mending_options ) {
1478 const mending_method &method = opt.method;
1479 const nc_color col = opt.doable ? c_white : c_light_gray;
1480
1481 auto reqs = method.requirements.obj();
1482 auto tools = reqs.get_folded_tools_list( fold_width, col, inv );
1483 auto comps = reqs.get_folded_components_list( fold_width, col, inv, is_crafting_component );
1484
1485 std::string descr;
1486 if( method.turns_into ) {
1487 descr += string_format( _( "Turns into: <color_cyan>%s</color>\n" ),
1488 method.turns_into->obj().name() );
1489 }
1490 if( method.also_mends ) {
1491 descr += string_format( _( "Also mends: <color_cyan>%s</color>\n" ),
1492 method.also_mends->obj().name() );
1493 }
1494 descr += string_format( _( "Time required: <color_cyan>%s</color>\n" ),
1495 to_string_approx( method.time ) );
1496 if( method.skills.empty() ) {
1497 descr += string_format( _( "Skills: <color_cyan>none</color>\n" ) );
1498 } else {
1499 descr += string_format( _( "Skills: %s\n" ),
1500 enumerate_as_string( method.skills.begin(), method.skills.end(),
1501 [this]( const std::pair<skill_id, int> &sk ) -> std::string {
1502 if( get_skill_level( sk.first ) >= sk.second )
1503 {
1504 return string_format( pgettext( "skill requirement",
1505 //~ %1$s: skill name, %2$s: current skill level, %3$s: required skill level
1506 "<color_cyan>%1$s</color> <color_green>(%2$d/%3$d)</color>" ),
1507 sk.first->name(), get_skill_level( sk.first ), sk.second );
1508 } else
1509 {
1510 return string_format( pgettext( "skill requirement",
1511 //~ %1$s: skill name, %2$s: current skill level, %3$s: required skill level
1512 "<color_cyan>%1$s</color> <color_yellow>(%2$d/%3$d)</color>" ),
1513 sk.first->name(), get_skill_level( sk.first ), sk.second );
1514 }
1515 } ) );
1516 }
1517
1518 for( const std::string &line : tools ) {
1519 descr += line + "\n";
1520 }
1521 for( const std::string &line : comps ) {
1522 descr += line + "\n";
1523 }
1524
1525 const std::string desc = method.description + "\n\n" + colorize( descr, col );
1526 menu.addentry_desc( -1, true, -1, method.name.translated(), desc );
1527 }
1528 menu.query();
1529 if( menu.ret < 0 ) {
1530 add_msg( _( "Never mind." ) );
1531 return;
1532 }
1533 sel = menu.ret;
1534 }
1535
1536 if( sel >= 0 ) {
1537 const mending_option &opt = mending_options[sel];
1538 if( !opt.doable ) {
1539 if( interactive ) {
1540 add_msg( m_info, _( "You are currently unable to mend the %s this way." ), obj->tname() );
1541 }
1542 return;
1543 }
1544
1545 const mending_method &method = opt.method;
1546 assign_activity( activity_id( "ACT_MEND_ITEM" ), to_moves<int>( method.time ) );
1547 activity.name = opt.fault.str();
1548 activity.str_values.emplace_back( method.id );
1549 activity.targets.push_back( std::move( obj ) );
1550 }
1551}

Definition at line 205 of file player.cpp.

206{
207 static const matec_id tec_none( "tec_none" );
208
209 // Each avoided hit consumes an available dodge
210 // When no more available we are likely to fail player::dodge_roll
211 dodges_left--;
212
213 // dodging throws of our aim unless we are either skilled at dodging or using a small weapon
214 if( is_armed() && weapon.is_gun() ) {
215 recoil += std::max( weapon.volume() / 250_ml - get_skill_level( skill_dodge ), 0 ) * rng( 0, 100 );
216 recoil = std::min( MAX_RECOIL, recoil );
217 }
218
219 // Even if we are not to train still call practice to prevent skill rust
220 difficulty = std::max( difficulty, 0.0f );
221 practice( skill_dodge, difficulty * 2, difficulty );
222
223 martial_arts_data->ma_ondodge_effects( *this );
224
225 // For adjacent attackers check for techniques usable upon successful dodge
226 if( source && square_dist( pos(), source->pos() ) == 1 ) {
227 matec_id tec = pick_technique( *source, used_weapon(), false, true, false );
228
229 if( tec != tec_none && !is_dead_state() ) {
230 if( get_stamina() < get_stamina_max() / 3 ) {
231 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You try to counterattack but you are too exhausted!" ) );
232 } else {

234 }
235 }
236 }

314 int rolls = 4;
315 if( worn_with_flag( "ROLLER_ONE" ) ) {
316 rolls += 2;
317 }

319 rolls--;

322 rolls--;
323 }
324
325 if( stability_roll() < dice( rolls, 10 ) ) {
326 if( !is_player() ) {
327 if( u_see ) {
328 add_msg( _( "%1$s loses their balance while being hit!" ), name );
329 }
330 } else {
331 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You lose your balance while being hit!" ) );
332 }
333 // This kind of downing is not subject to immunity.

◆ practice()

void player::practice ( const skill_id &  id,
int  amount,
int  cap = 99,
bool  suppress_warning = false 
)

This handles giving xp for a skill.

Definition at line 2329 of file player.cpp.

2330{
2331 SkillLevel &level = get_skill_level_object( id );
2332 const Skill &skill = id.obj();
2333 std::string skill_name = skill.name();
2334
2335 if( !level.can_train() && !in_sleep_state() ) {
2336 // If leveling is disabled, don't train, don't drain focus, don't print anything
2337 // Leaving as a skill method rather than global for possible future skill cap setting
2338 return;
2339 }
2340
2341 const auto highest_skill = [&]() {
2342 std::pair<skill_id, int> result( skill_id::NULL_ID(), -1 );
2343 for( const auto &pair : *_skills ) {
2344 const SkillLevel &lobj = pair.second;
2345 if( lobj.level() > result.second ) {
2346 result = std::make_pair( pair.first, lobj.level() );
2347 }
2348 }
2349 return result.first;
2350 };
2351
2352 const bool isSavant = has_trait( trait_SAVANT );
2353 const skill_id savantSkill = isSavant ? highest_skill() : skill_id::NULL_ID();
2354
2355 amount = adjust_for_focus( amount );
2356
2357 if( has_trait( trait_PACIFIST ) && skill.is_combat_skill() ) {
2358 if( !one_in( 3 ) ) {
2359 amount = 0;
2360 }
2361 }
2362 if( has_trait_flag( "PRED2" ) && skill.is_combat_skill() ) {
2363 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
2364 amount *= 2;
2365 }
2366 }
2367 if( has_trait_flag( "PRED3" ) && skill.is_combat_skill() ) {
2368 amount *= 2;
2369 }
2370
2371 if( has_trait_flag( "PRED4" ) && skill.is_combat_skill() ) {
2372 amount *= 3;
2373 }
2374
2375 if( isSavant && id != savantSkill ) {
2376 amount /= 2;
2377 }
2378
2379 if( amount > 0 && get_skill_level( id ) > cap ) { //blunt grinding cap implementation for crafting
2380 amount = 0;
2381 if( !suppress_warning ) {
2382 handle_skill_warning( id, false );
2383 }
2384 }
2385 if( amount > 0 && level.isTraining() ) {
2386 int oldLevel = get_skill_level( id );
2387 get_skill_level_object( id ).train( amount );
2388 int newLevel = get_skill_level( id );
2389 if( is_player() && newLevel > oldLevel ) {
2390 add_msg( m_good, _( "Your skill in %s has increased to %d!" ), skill_name, newLevel );
2391 }
2392 if( is_player() && newLevel > cap ) {
2393 //inform player immediately that the current recipe can't be used to train further
2394 add_msg( m_info, _( "You feel that %s tasks of this level are becoming trivial." ),
2395 skill_name );
2396 }
2397
2398 int chance_to_drop = focus_pool;
2399 focus_pool -= chance_to_drop / 100;
2400 // Apex Predators don't think about much other than killing.
2401 // They don't lose Focus when practicing combat skills.
2402 if( ( rng( 1, 100 ) <= ( chance_to_drop % 100 ) ) && ( !( has_trait_flag( "PRED4" ) &&
2403 skill.is_combat_skill() ) ) ) {
2404 focus_pool--;
2405 }
2406 }
2407
2408 get_skill_level_object( id ).practice();
2409}

◆ reduce_charges() [1/2]

item player::reduce_charges ( int  position,
int  quantity 
)

Remove charges from a specific item (given by its item position).

The item must exist and it must be counted by charges.

Parameters
positionItem position of the item.
quantityThe number of charges to remove, must not be larger than the current charges of the item.
Returns
An item that contains the removed charges, it's effectively a copy of the item with the proper charges.

Definition at line 627 of file player.cpp.

628{
629 item &it = i_at( position );
630 if( it.is_null() ) {
631 debugmsg( "invalid item position %d for reduce_charges", position );
632 return item();
633 }
634 if( it.charges <= quantity ) {
635 return i_rem( position );
636 }
637 it.mod_charges( -quantity );
638 item tmp( it );
639 tmp.charges = quantity;
640 return tmp;
641}

1202 name, base.tname() );

1210 const item::reload_option & rhs ) {

◆ select_ammo() [2/2]

item::reload_option player::select_ammo ( const item &  base,
std::vector< item::reload_option >  opts 
) const

Select ammo from the provided options.

Definition at line 899 of file player.cpp.

901{
902 if( opts.empty() ) {
903 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "Never mind." ) );
904 return item::reload_option();
905 }
906
907 uilist menu;
908 menu.text = string_format( base.is_watertight_container() ? _( "Refill %s" ) :
909 base.has_flag( "RELOAD_AND_SHOOT" ) ? _( "Select ammo for %s" ) : _( "Reload %s" ),
910 base.tname() );
911
912 // Construct item names
913 std::vector<std::string> names;
914 std::transform( opts.begin(), opts.end(),
915 std::back_inserter( names ), [&]( const item::reload_option & e ) {
916 if( e.ammo->is_magazine() && e.ammo->ammo_data() ) {
917 if( e.ammo->ammo_current() == itype_battery ) {
918 // This battery ammo is not a real object that can be recovered but pseudo-object that represents charge
919 //~ battery storage (charges)
920 return string_format( pgettext( "magazine", "%1$s (%2$d)" ), e.ammo->type_name(),
921 e.ammo->ammo_remaining() );
922 } else {
923 //~ magazine with ammo (count)
924 return string_format( pgettext( "magazine", "%1$s with %2$s (%3$d)" ), e.ammo->type_name(),
925 e.ammo->ammo_data()->nname( e.ammo->ammo_remaining() ), e.ammo->ammo_remaining() );
926 }
927 } else if( e.ammo->is_watertight_container() ||
928 ( e.ammo->is_ammo_container() && is_worn( *e.ammo ) ) ) {
929 // worn ammo containers should be named by their contents with their location also updated below
930 return e.ammo->contents.front().display_name();
931
932 } else {
933 const_cast<item_location &>( ammo_location ).make_dirty();
934 return ( ammo_location && ammo_location == e.ammo ? "* " : "" ) + e.ammo->display_name();
935 }
936 } );
937
938 // Get location descriptions
939 std::vector<std::string> where;
940 std::transform( opts.begin(), opts.end(),
941 std::back_inserter( where ), [this]( const item::reload_option & e ) {
942 bool is_ammo_container = e.ammo->is_ammo_container();
943 if( is_ammo_container || e.ammo->is_container() ) {
944 if( is_ammo_container && is_worn( *e.ammo ) ) {
945 return e.ammo->type_name();
946 }
947 return string_format( _( "%s, %s" ), e.ammo->type_name(), e.ammo.describe( &g->u ) );
948 }
949 return e.ammo.describe( &g->u );
950 } );
951
952 // Pads elements to match longest member and return length
953 auto pad = []( std::vector<std::string> &vec, int n, int t ) -> int {
954 for( const auto &e : vec )
955 {
956 n = std::max( n, utf8_width( e, true ) + t );
957 }
958 for( auto &e : vec )
959 {
960 e += std::string( n - utf8_width( e, true ), ' ' );
961 }
962 return n;
963 };
964
965 // Pad the first column including 4 trailing spaces
966 int w = pad( names, utf8_width( menu.text, true ), 6 );
967 menu.text.insert( 0, 2, ' ' ); // add space for UI hotkeys
968 menu.text += std::string( w + 2 - utf8_width( menu.text, true ), ' ' );
969
970 // Pad the location similarly (excludes leading "| " and trailing " ")
971 w = pad( where, utf8_width( _( "| Location " ) ) - 3, 6 );
972 menu.text += _( "| Location " );
973 menu.text += std::string( w + 3 - utf8_width( _( "| Location " ) ), ' ' );
974
975 menu.text += _( "| Amount " );
976 menu.text += _( "| Moves " );
977
978 // We only show ammo statistics for guns and magazines
979 if( base.is_gun() || base.is_magazine() ) {
980 menu.text += _( "| Damage | Pierce " );
981 }
982
983 auto draw_row = [&]( int idx ) {
984 const auto &sel = opts[ idx ];
985 std::string row = string_format( "%s| %s |", names[ idx ], where[ idx ] );
986 row += string_format( ( sel.ammo->is_ammo() ||
987 sel.ammo->is_ammo_container() ) ? " %-7d |" : " |", sel.qty() );
988 row += string_format( " %-7d ", sel.moves() );
989
990 if( base.is_gun() || base.is_magazine() ) {
991 const itype *ammo = sel.ammo->is_ammo_container() ? sel.ammo->contents.front().ammo_data() :
992 sel.ammo->ammo_data();
993 if( ammo ) {
994 const damage_instance &dam = ammo->ammo->damage;
995 const damage_unit &du = dam.damage_units.front();
996 if( du.damage_multiplier != 1.0f ) {
997 float dam_amt = du.amount;
998 row += string_format( "| %-3d*%3d%% ", static_cast<int>( dam_amt ),
999 clamp( static_cast<int>( du.damage_multiplier * 100 ), 0, 999 ) );
1000 } else {
1001 float dam_amt = dam.total_damage();
1002 row += string_format( "| %-8d ", static_cast<int>( dam_amt ) );
1003 }
1004 if( du.res_mult != 1.0f ) {
1005 row += string_format( "| %-3d/%3d%%",
1006 static_cast<int>( du.res_pen ), static_cast<int>( 100 * du.res_mult ) );
1007 } else {
1008 row += string_format( "| %-8d", static_cast<int>( du.res_pen ) );
1009 }
1010 } else {
1011 row += "| | ";
1012 }
1013 }
1014 return row;
1015 };
1016
1017 const ammotype base_ammotype( base.ammo_default().str() );
1018 itype_id last = uistate.lastreload[ base_ammotype ];
1019 // We keep the last key so that pressing the key twice (for example, r-r for reload)
1020 // will always pick the first option on the list.
1021 int last_key = inp_mngr.get_previously_pressed_key();
1022 bool last_key_bound = false;
1023 // This is the entry that has out default
1024 int default_to = 0;
1025
1026 // If last_key is RETURN, don't use that to override hotkey
1027 if( last_key == '\n' ) {
1028 last_key_bound = true;
1029 default_to = -1;
1030 }
1031
1032 for( auto i = 0; i < static_cast<int>( opts.size() ); ++i ) {
1033 const item &ammo = opts[ i ].ammo->is_ammo_container() ? opts[ i ].ammo->contents.front() :
1034 *opts[ i ].ammo;
1035
1036 char hotkey = -1;
1037 if( has_item( ammo ) ) {
1038 // if ammo in player possession and either it or any container has a valid invlet use this
1039 if( ammo.invlet ) {
1040 hotkey = ammo.invlet;
1041 } else {
1042 for( const auto obj : parents( ammo ) ) {
1043 if( obj->invlet ) {
1044 hotkey = obj->invlet;
1045 break;
1046 }
1047 }
1048 }
1049 }
1050 if( last == ammo.typeId() ) {
1051 if( !last_key_bound && hotkey == -1 ) {
1052 // If this is the first occurrence of the most recently used type of ammo and the hotkey
1053 // was not already set above then set it to the keypress that opened this prompt
1054 hotkey = last_key;
1055 last_key_bound = true;
1056 }
1057 if( !last_key_bound ) {
1058 // Pressing the last key defaults to the first entry of compatible type
1059 default_to = i;
1060 last_key_bound = true;
1061 }
1062 }
1063 if( hotkey == last_key ) {
1064 last_key_bound = true;
1065 // Prevent the default from being used: key is bound to something already
1066 default_to = -1;
1067 }
1068
1069 menu.addentry( i, true, hotkey, draw_row( i ) );
1070 }
1071
1072 struct reload_callback : public uilist_callback {
1073 public:
1074 std::vector<item::reload_option> &opts;
1075 const std::function<std::string( int )> draw_row;
1076 int last_key;
1077 const int default_to;
1078 const bool can_partial_reload;
1079
1080 reload_callback( std::vector<item::reload_option> &_opts,
1081 std::function<std::string( int )> _draw_row,
1082 int _last_key, int _default_to, bool _can_partial_reload ) :
1083 opts( _opts ), draw_row( _draw_row ),
1084 last_key( _last_key ), default_to( _default_to ),
1085 can_partial_reload( _can_partial_reload )
1086 {}
1087
1088 bool key( const input_context &, const input_event &event, int idx, uilist *menu ) override {
1089 auto cur_key = event.get_first_input();
1090 if( default_to != -1 && cur_key == last_key ) {
1091 // Select the first entry on the list
1092 menu->ret = default_to;
1093 return true;
1094 }
1095 if( idx < 0 || idx >= static_cast<int>( opts.size() ) ) {
1096 return false;
1097 }
1098 auto &sel = opts[ idx ];
1099 switch( cur_key ) {
1100 case KEY_LEFT:
1101 if( can_partial_reload ) {
1102 sel.qty( sel.qty() - 1 );
1103 menu->entries[ idx ].txt = draw_row( idx );
1104 }
1105 return true;
1106
1107 case KEY_RIGHT:
1108 if( can_partial_reload ) {
1109 sel.qty( sel.qty() + 1 );
1110 menu->entries[ idx ].txt = draw_row( idx );
1111 }
1112 return true;
1113 }
1114 return false;
1115 }
1116 } cb( opts, draw_row, last_key, default_to, !base.has_flag( "RELOAD_ONE" ) );
1117 menu.callback = &cb;
1118
1119 menu.query();
1120 if( menu.ret < 0 || static_cast<size_t>( menu.ret ) >= opts.size() ) {
1121 add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "Never mind." ) );
1122 return item::reload_option();
1123 }
1124
1125 const item_location &sel = opts[ menu.ret ].ammo;
1126 uistate.lastreload[ ammotype( base.ammo_default().str() ) ] = sel->is_ammo_container() ?
1127 sel->contents.front().typeId() :
1128 sel->typeId();
1129 return opts[ menu.ret ];
1130}
achievement_comparison::last
@ last

int utf8_width(const char *s, const bool ignore_tags)
Definition: catacharset.cpp:142
input_context
Represents a context in which a set of actions can be performed.
Definition: input.h:386
input_manager::get_previously_pressed_key
int get_previously_pressed_key() const

◆ select_item_component()

comp_selection< item_comp > player::select_item_component ( const std::vector< item_comp > &  components,
int  batch,
inventory &  map_inv,
bool  can_cancel = false,
const std::function< bool(const item &)> &  filter = return_true<item>,
bool  player_inv = true 
)

Definition at line 1308 of file crafting.cpp.

1311{
1312 std::vector<item_comp> player_has;
1313 std::vector<item_comp> map_has;
1314 std::vector<item_comp> mixed;
1315
1316 comp_selection<item_comp> selected;
1317
1318 for( const auto &component : components ) {
1319 itype_id type = component.type;
1320 int count = ( component.count > 0 ) ? component.count * batch : std::abs( component.count );
1321
1322 if( item::count_by_charges( type ) && count > 0 ) {
1323 int map_charges = map_inv.charges_of( type, INT_MAX, filter );
1324
1325 // If map has infinite charges, just use them
1326 if( map_charges == item::INFINITE_CHARGES ) {
1327 selected.use_from = use_from_map;
1328 selected.comp = component;
1329 return selected;
1330 }
1331 if( player_inv ) {
1332 int player_charges = charges_of( type, INT_MAX, filter );
1333 bool found = false;
1334 if( player_charges >= count ) {
1335 player_has.push_back( component );
1336 found = true;
1337 }
1338 if( map_charges >= count ) {
1339 map_has.push_back( component );
1340 found = true;
1341 }
1342 if( !found && player_charges + map_charges >= count ) {
1343 mixed.push_back( component );
1344 }
1345 } else {
1346 if( map_charges >= count ) {
1347 map_has.push_back( component );
1348 }
1349 }
1350 } else { // Counting by units, not charges
1351
1352 // Can't use pseudo items as components
1353 if( player_inv ) {
1354 bool found = false;
1355 if( has_amount( type, count, false, filter ) ) {
1356 player_has.push_back( component );
1357 found = true;
1358 }
1359 if( map_inv.has_components( type, count, filter ) ) {
1360 map_has.push_back( component );
1361 found = true;
1362 }
1363 if( !found &&
1364 amount_of( type, false, std::numeric_limits<int>::max(), filter ) +
1365 map_inv.amount_of( type, false, std::numeric_limits<int>::max(), filter ) >= count ) {
1366 mixed.push_back( component );
1367 }
1368 } else {
1369 if( map_inv.has_components( type, count, filter ) ) {
1370 map_has.push_back( component );
1371 }
1372 }
1373 }
1374 }
1375
1376 /* select 1 component to use */
1377 if( player_has.size() + map_has.size() + mixed.size() == 1 ) { // Only 1 choice
1378 if( player_has.size() == 1 ) {
1379 selected.use_from = use_from_player;
1380 selected.comp = player_has[0];
1381 } else if( map_has.size() == 1 ) {
1382 selected.use_from = use_from_map;
1383 selected.comp = map_has[0];
1384 } else {
1385 selected.use_from = use_from_both;
1386 selected.comp = mixed[0];
1387 }
1388 } else if( is_npc() ) {
1389 if( !player_has.empty() ) {
1390 selected.use_from = use_from_player;
1391 selected.comp = player_has[0];
1392 } else if( !map_has.empty() ) {
1393 selected.use_from = use_from_map;
1394 selected.comp = map_has[0];
1395 } else {
1396 debugmsg( "Attempted a recipe with no available components!" );
1397 selected.use_from = cancel;
1398 return selected;
1399 }
1400 } else { // Let the player pick which component they want to use
1401 uilist cmenu;
1402 // Populate options with the names of the items
1403 for( auto &map_ha : map_has ) { // Index 0-(map_has.size()-1)
1404 std::string tmpStr = string_format( _( "%s (%d/%d nearby)" ),
1405 item::nname( map_ha.type ),
1406 ( map_ha.count * batch ),
1407 item::count_by_charges( map_ha.type ) ?
1408 map_inv.charges_of( map_ha.type, INT_MAX, filter ) :
1409 map_inv.amount_of( map_ha.type, false, INT_MAX, filter ) );
1410 cmenu.addentry( tmpStr );
1411 }
1412 for( auto &player_ha : player_has ) { // Index map_has.size()-(map_has.size()+player_has.size()-1)
1413 std::string tmpStr = string_format( _( "%s (%d/%d on person)" ),
1414 item::nname( player_ha.type ),
1415 ( player_ha.count * batch ),
1416 item::count_by_charges( player_ha.type ) ?
1417 charges_of( player_ha.type, INT_MAX, filter ) :
1418 amount_of( player_ha.type, false, INT_MAX, filter ) );
1419 cmenu.addentry( tmpStr );
1420 }
1421 for( auto &component : mixed ) {
1422 // Index player_has.size()-(map_has.size()+player_has.size()+mixed.size()-1)
1423 int available = item::count_by_charges( component.type ) ?
1424 map_inv.charges_of( component.type, INT_MAX, filter ) +
1425 charges_of( component.type, INT_MAX, filter ) :
1426 map_inv.amount_of( component.type, false, INT_MAX, filter ) +
1427 amount_of( component.type, false, INT_MAX, filter );
1428 std::string tmpStr = string_format( _( "%s (%d/%d nearby & on person)" ),
1429 item::nname( component.type ),
1430 component.count * batch,
1431 available );
1432 cmenu.addentry( tmpStr );
1433 }
1434
1435 // Unlike with tools, it's a bad thing if there aren't any components available
1436 if( cmenu.entries.empty() ) {
1437 if( player_inv ) {
1438 if( has_trait( trait_DEBUG_HS ) ) {
1439 selected.use_from = use_from_player;
1440 return selected;
1441 }
1442 }
1443 debugmsg( "Attempted a recipe with no available components!" );
1444 selected.use_from = cancel;
1445 return selected;
1446 }
1447
1448 cmenu.allow_cancel = can_cancel;
1449
1450 // Get the selection via a menu popup
1451 cmenu.title = _( "Use which component?" );
1452 cmenu.query();
1453
1454 if( cmenu.ret < 0 ||
1455 static_cast<size_t>( cmenu.ret ) >= map_has.size() + player_has.size() + mixed.size() ) {
1456 selected.use_from = cancel;
1457 return selected;
1458 }
1459
1460 size_t uselection = static_cast<size_t>( cmenu.ret );
1461 if( uselection < map_has.size() ) {
1462 selected.use_from = usage::use_from_map;
1463 selected.comp = map_has[uselection];
1464 } else if( uselection < map_has.size() + player_has.size() ) {
1465 uselection -= map_has.size();
1466 selected.use_from = usage::use_from_player;
1467 selected.comp = player_has[uselection];
1468 } else {
1469 uselection -= map_has.size() + player_has.size();
1470 selected.use_from = usage::use_from_both;
1471 selected.comp = mixed[uselection];
1472 }
1473 }
1474
1475 return selected;
1476}

bool has_components(const itype_id &it, int quantity, const std::function< bool(const item &)> &filter=return_true< item >) const

1278{
1279 assert( !alternatives.empty() );
1280 if( alternatives.size() == 1 || !is_avatar() ) {
1281 return alternatives.front();
1282 }
1283
1284 uilist menu;
1285

1287 // Write with a large width and then just re-join the lines, because
1288 // uilist does its own wrapping and we want to rely on that.
1289 std::vector<std::string> component_lines =
1290 req->get_folded_components_list( TERMX - 4, c_light_gray, inv, filter, batch, "",
1291 requirement_display_flags::no_unavailable );

1293 }
